text: Opening credits roll as...
TUCKER, 24, handsome and self-possessed, pulls his car in the parking lot, and gives the Guy Head Nod to a familiar passer-by as he strides coolly into the law school.
Ever fuck a deaf chick? Of course you haven't.
In the common area of the law library, a mixed group is sitting around bullshitting instead of studying.
(a girl) I still can’t believe you're getting married, Jeff.
I can’t believe she said yes. The group laughs as we ANGLE on JEFF, 24, a thick-necked, high school athlete no one has ever accused of being a ne
Shit, man, I’m starting to regret that she didn’t say no. This wedding planning stuff is nuts. I spent all night looking through wedding magazines and books of white flowers. Just white.
Jesus. I hope I never have to get married. ANGLE ON Tucker entering the library.
With your face, I think you’re safe. Tucker stands behind Jeff with a smile waiting for Jeff t notice him while the friends at the table gawk at Jeff.
What?
Raise your hand if you've ever fucked a deaf girl. A beat. Jeff whips around as Tucker smiles deviously and slowly raises his hand. The group bursts into hysterics.
Bullshit! No way. Deaf girls are hot. Lies. Can you hear me now?
You had sex with a deaf chick?
You're deaf too now? Tucker starts mock-signing. + eH
(in a mongoloid voice) Yes, Jeff, I had sex with a deaf girl.
Didn’t you hook up with a mute girl last semester? You’re 2/3 of the way to a Helen Keller.
Jeff and Tucker are next to each other in an auditorium s class. Everyone has laptops open in front of them.
I almost shit myself when those cops busted in. I thought she set me up or something.
Bad boys, bad boys, whatcha gonna do, whatcha gonna do when you’re fucking a deaf girl and the cops come for you? The professor is perturbed with the talking in the back.
Mr. Max. What is your take on this issue?
I’m sorry, what issue is that?
Are you not paying attention Mr. Max?
I wasn't, I apologize, I was busy talking about having sex with a deaf girl. The class laughs.
Charming...and oddly appropriate. Do you or do you not feel that Little People should be a protected class?
+ eH
You mean midgets?
Yes, Mr. Max, if you must, midgets. Do you think they should be protected?
What are we protecting them from, eagles and poachers and stuff? Like an endangered species? The class erupts again.
Poachers?
It could happen. You know if Kanye showed up to a club in a midget stoll, they’d be extinct in a week.
Mr. Max if you didn’t do the reading, then...

No, I don't think midgets should be considered a protected class for the purposes of employment discrimination law. I think their physical limitations put them squarely within the business necessity and reasonable accommodation defenses of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
Where do you draw the line then?
I’m not sure. I figure it’s like riding a roller coaster. You must be this high to get ADA protection. Tucker puts his hand at chest level and the class laughs.

Very funny, Mr. Max. What if I told you that I just finished a pro bono case involving a gentleman's club that terminated the employment of a dancer with dwarfism because she--  Tucker lurches forward in his seat.
You represented a midget stripper?
They prefer the term ‘Little Person’.
Was she fired?
No, they gave her her job back. Tucker has that mischievous twinkle in his eye.
What club was it?
Mr. Max, if you’re genuinely interested in the case, come to office hours and I'll fill you in. Until then let’s remember this is a constitutional law class, not Adult Friend Finder.
Touche! I will shut up now. Aside to Jeff, as Professor drones on about the case.
So, you ready for your bachelor party tonight?
Locked and loaded.

I’m gonna go get Aaron, meet us at the campus bar after class. Tucker closes his laptop as we go to black. INT. AARON’S APT. - MINUTES LATER 7 The apartment is dark and spartan. Aaron is slouched down the room’s only chair, in front of a meticulously organiz media center, playing a Grand Theft Auto-style game. Aaron is 24, tall and lanky with angular features. He’s almost finicky about his appearance, but underneath, he’s maladjusted, beaten down Star Trek nerd. He’s got a heads on that is connected to his controller.

I’m going down the alley to beat up the hooker. Watch my six. Aaron's phone rings. He puts his Bluetooth in his other e In SPLIT SCREEN, Tucker barrels through city traffic. Aar his digital doppelganger; running down pedestrians on scr as Tucker sends them running for cover in real life.
Yo, Aaron. It’s Tucker. Aaron flips out and hits the video game controller furiou
What the hell is going on!? Aaron's car is getting shot up from behind.
I’m coming to get you, we’re going drinking. Aaron's character dies on the screen.
What the hell!? YOU SUCK!!
What?
Is this your idea of having my back?!
This is a great idea! I need a drink and you need some daylight.
What kind of wingman are you, you selfish little shit-for-brains?! (MORE )

I should come over to your house, cut off your stubby virgin hands and beat you to death with them, HotWheelz! INT. AARON’S APT. — CONTINUOUS 9 Aaron rips off both headsets, hurls his controller, and storms into the kitchen. EXT. STREET/INT. TUCKER’S CAR 10 Tucker pulls up to the curb in front of Aaron’ building. INT. AARON’S KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER 11 Aaron is standing against the counter eating cereal.

Ahhhh, Captain Crunch. My old friend. (baby talk) You wouldn't leave me hanging in an alley full of hookers. I’m not gonna catch you in the cupboard sucking off Toucan Sam. Noooo, you have integ-wuh-tee and disci-pwin. EXT. AARON’S APARTMENT —- SIMULTANEOUS 12 A chair with “HERS” stenciled on the back and an over-flo box sit outside. “HERS” has been crossed out and “WHORES” written in Sharpie underneath. “WHORE’S BELONGINGS” is scrawled on the top of the box. Tucker opens the lid. Something is written on the inside.

(reading, but to himself) Take whatever you want, her box is apparently open to all. Tucker sifts through the box: Han Solo and Princess Leia figurines with their kung-fu grip hands melted together, women’s clothes, pictures of a blissful Aaron and a strik but disinterested, brunette. The box is peppered with unu tampons that have been snapped in half.  13 10. INT. AARON’S APT. — CONTINUOUS 13 Tucker barges in without knocking and opens all the drape flooding the dark, depressive sanctuary of pain with ligh
Look at this place. It’s a shrine to cuckoldry and rage. Aaron plops down in his chair. The back has “HIS” stencil into it, matching the “HERS” outside.
You ready?
What are you babbling about?
We're going to the bar. I just told you on the phone.
I don’t pay attention to what you say. I just wait for you to stop talking about yourself, get bored, and hang up. AARON stares blankly ahead at the television.
Did Sarah call yet? Tucker goes into the kitchen to get himself a chair and g two beers from the fridge.
No. She probably has trouble talking with a dick in her mouth. Tucker sets the chair down, grabs the remote, and stops o the opening credits of Jem & the Holograms.
This cartoon is disturbingly hot. Can you imagine a threesome with Jem and Jerrica?
I can imagine them both cheating on me.  11.
Jerrica runs a foster home. She wouldn’t cheat.

She voluntarily surrounds herself with shattered little lives so her dysfunctional existence feels more normal. You think she wouldn’t pull her cartoon panties to the side for the first guy who tells her she’s pretty? Aaron waits in vain for Tucker to respond.

Of course she would. They all would. Even the foster kids, those validation seeking little sluts. Click. Tucker changes the channel, a DeBeers commercial. Aaron lurches forward jabbing his finger at the televisio

I'm onto your game DeBeers-- diamonds are almost worthless other than the value attached to them by the silly tramps you've brainwashed into thinking “diamond equals love.” Guess what sluts, your quest for the perfect princess cut is supporting terrorism and genocide. Congratulations, your avarice has managed to destroy an entire continent!
Sarah kept the ring?
I hope you die in a fire.
You act like you're the first person in the world to get cheated on. It happens to everyone, dude, even me.
Oh, really? Does everyone catch their fiancee sucking off a rapper?  14 15 12.
Aaron lets himself in with keys attached to an old, tatte Duke GI Joe keychain. He’s carrying a box of Earl Grey te and a bag of throat lozenges.
Hey honey, how are you doing? Sarah is vigorously pumping her head in the crotch of Grillionaire, an iced-out white rapper. He’s sloppily eat a sandwich and using the remote when he spots Aaron.
SARAH jerks up and turns panicked to see Aaron just as he slams the front door behind him. INT. AARON’S LIVING ROOM - BACK TO CURRENT SCENE 15
Hey, who knew blowjobs were good for sore throats, right?
The most rewarding part of our friendship is your ability to find personal amusement in the destruction of my life.
It’s not that bad, dude. You always get stuck in these cycles. When you get depressed like this, you need to ask yourself What would Tucker do?, and then go do that.
I already know what you would do, and I have no desire to get HIV from one of the cum dumpsters into whom you shoot your emotional pain every weekend.
You know HIV is basically curable now. It doesn’t even show up in Magic Johnson's blood anymore.  16 13.
You're telling me that Magic Johnson is black AND has AIDS...and he has it better than me?
Campus Bar is part sports bar, part dingy hook-up dungeon Tucker is flirting aggressively with Leslie, a gorgeous c waitress. Aaron, disgusted, is staring off at the TV.
I love kids. When I graduate I want to work with children, and have a bunch of my own. What about you?

He does, they’re just all in the compost heap behind Planned Parenthood. Leslie doesn’t know whether to be creeped out or disguste

Run along baby, man talk. I have your number, I’11l call you. Leslie walks away, clearly smitten. Aaron shakes his head

Excuse me?
I think you heard me.
Oh, I heard you, Hero. You don’t want me flirting with your server. I didn’t know she belonged to you. I thought she was an individual with free will?
It’s a figure of speech, bro.

Well, BRO, here’s another figure of speech for you: Mind your own fucking business. I’m sorry I’ve accomplished more in 30 minutes with Leslie than you have in two years, but she looked pretty happy talking to me. Or maybe she rubs her crotch against all the customers.
I think it might be time for you to leave.
Or maybe it’s just time for you to get me another drink. Tucker waves his empty glass.  15.

The wedding is next weekend, man. I’m not just going to leave Kristy hanging because of some stupid no- touch policy. That’s your issue, not mine.  17 18.

I-6. Isaiah One Six. ANGLE ON Jeff as his cell phone rings.
It’s Career Services from law school, probably about a job interview. Hello? ANGLE ON Tucker, Aaron and Kristy at a table in the back the room. Tucker has the phone tilted out so they can hea  19.

From the sole of your foot to the top of your head there is no soundness- only wounds and welts and open sores. Hugh, honey, who does that sound like? ANGLE ON Jeff as Mr. Jorgens talks to his sons sitting ne to Jeff.

Of course that’s who Isaiah’s talking about. The open sores are from having their horns and tails cut off so they can blend in with the humans. SPLIT SCREEN with Jeff and Tucker, Aaron and Kristy.

Don’t drag me into this. There’s a Next Generation marathon this weekend. I am just fine lusting after Deanna Troy and stewing in my cocoon of loneliness and anger.
He hasn’t been out of the house since his girl tore out his heart and stomped it with bling shoes! Aaron needs this!

I need this like I need hepatitis Cc.
You need this! WE ALL NEED THIS!! IT’S OUR DESTINY AS MEN!!

Oh by the way, BRO, make sure to tell Leslie that I’m an asshole and that she should stay away. It’1ll only help me.
At the curb in front of Jeff’s apartment complex, Jeff in driver’s seat, Tucker and Aaron in the back.

Don't Groomzilla me! Those squirrel hunters wouldn't know a good time if it jumped out of the Bible and landed on the front lawn of their megachurch! Jeff stomps down the hall to the bedroom, Kristy in tow.
The room is well-appointed with a strong feminine touch. yanks a gym bag from the closet, grabs some dirty jeans a shirts off the back of a chair.

You know I can’t let him go off by himself. That’s when the really bad stuff happens. He needs me to have his back.
Who’s got your back? Aaron?
Tucker’s got my back.
Tucker says he’s got your back. Except you’re always the one bailing him out. I wish you took care of me as well as you take care of Tucker.
That’s a bunch of crap! I always look out for you. You’re my number one priority.
Really? When have I taken precedence? When have you chosen me over Tucker? Give me an example. Just one.
I’m marrying you aren’t I?  24. Kristy looks incredulously at Jeff. He tries to salvage s credibility before it’s too late.

Honey, you know I’m cool with you going to a strip club. If we didn’t have so much to do, I’d go with you. But we have all the final appointments this weekend. You need to be there.

COMPROMISE!? That's all I've been doing! Your dad didn't want a bachelor party with strippers and booze, so I said fine, we'll do an engagement party at the church. I want a beach ceremony? What’s up guys?  26. Kristy tries to put on her “Everything is fine” face.

Oh no. Jeff didn’t say anything about that. Why didn’t you tell me, dude? That’s not cool. It’s your wedding, man. Jeff is wide-eyed at Tucker in frustration and anger. A beat.
We'll just go out in town. We can do Charlotte after your honeymoon.
Kristy, that way you can come too.
Sure, that sounds like fun actually. Tucker grabs Jeff's duffel from him and gives it to Krist
(to Kristy) He doesn’t need this anymore. (to Jeff) You ready, dude?  27. Jeff nods.
